pullRequest.title: Add FST Index using lucene lib to speedup regexp queries
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add FST index to support regex queries on text, this is pulling in FST construction and matching code from lucene.
On disk index sizes are smaller than the text with letting go off of features and only supporting regex queries.
Works better for prefix queries and currently support is only added for dictionary encoded columns.
On some of the columns I tested on reduction in on-disk size is close to 4-6 times.
To enable FST index, column has to be dictionary encoded and with below config.
FST Index currently generates one file: FST index file (.lucene.fst), if inverted index is enabled
this will further be able to take advantage of that.
"fieldConfigList":[
{
"name":"text_col_1",
"encodingType":"DICTIONARY",
"indexType":"FST"
}
]

I suggest adding tests for both aggregation and selection queries.
Also, test both segment level and inter segment execution. I initially didn't add text index tests for inter segment and there were few multi-threading related bugs in how I was using lucene parser.

You should also add tests for queries where REGEXP_LIKE filter is combined with another filter(s) using AND/OR to ensure the docID intersection/union is working fine.
